topic.title: Application Access Testing
topic.shortdesc: The Couchbase Role-Based Access Control system ensures that application must pass the correct credentials, in order to perform specific operations. Using the Couchbase Web Console in combination with N1QL queries, executed by means of the cbq tool, you can establish access control on one or more buckets, and experiment with the effect this has on applications' attempt to read or write data. This is demonstrated by the examples in this section.

section.title: Test Applications' Access-Privileges
section.p: You can test in three stages:

ol.li: Create a bucket containing documents, different levels of access to which can be assigned to different users. This is described in the section Create and Populate a Bucket.
Create users with different role-combinations. This is described in Create Users and Assign Roles.
Use the cbq tool to attempt bucket-access, according to the roles you have assigned different users. This is described in Perform cbq Access Tests.
